metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1612 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The LoadIC::UpdateCaches function in ic/ic.cc in Google V8, as used in Google Chrome before 48.0.2564.82, does not ensure receiver compatibility before performing a cast of an unspecified variable, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unknown other impact via crafted JavaScript code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1612` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu1.1222
chromium-browser-l10n - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu1.1222
chromium-chromedriver - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu1.1222
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu1.1222
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu1.1222
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.12.5-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.12.5-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.12.5-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.12.5-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.12.5-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.12.5-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu1.1222').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.12.5-0ubuntu1').
